question: What is the name of the event organized by The Sherman Centre for Digital Scholarship (SCDS) on October 1, 2025?
answer: The event is named "Returning Research Data Management".

question: When is the "Returning Research Data Management" event scheduled?
answer: The event is scheduled for October 1, 2025, from 2:30 PM UTC to 3:30 PM UTC.

question: Who is organizing the "Returning Research Data Management" event?
answer: The Sherman Centre for Digital Scholarship (SCDS) is organizing the event.

question: What keywords are associated with the "Returning Research Data Management" event?
answer: The keywords are "Returning", "Research Data Management", "SCDS Sponsored Events", and "Workshops".

question: How can I contact the organizer for the "Returning Research Data Management" event?

question: Who is the target audience for the "Returning Research Data Management" event?

question: What is the title of the Python workshop scheduled for October 2025?
answer: The workshop is titled "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster".

question: What are the dates and times for the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" workshop?
answer: The workshop runs on Wednesday, Oct 1, 2025, from 9 AM to 12 PM, and Thursday, Oct 2, 2025, from 9 AM to 12 PM.

question: Where can I register for the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" workshop?
answer: You can register using the form at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSddD0MRn3miKCRFHf1VwtxrrzlKO-7uylVUDt4oV4HIbHPu6w/viewform.

question: What are the prerequisites for attending the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" workshop?
answer: Students should have some experience with the shell (e.g., HPC Shell Basics), experience submitting jobs (e.g., HPC Essentials), and at least one introductory Python course.

question: What will the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" workshop cover?
answer: This hands-on workshop will give students insight into running Python code on high performance computing clusters, including setting up jobs for batch submission, loading dependent Python packages, and interactive use on the cluster.

question: How many sessions does the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" workshop have?
answer: It is a two-session workshop.

question: What keywords are associated with the "Intermediate Python: Python on the Cluster" event?
answer: The keywords are "Python", "Programming", and "Shell".

question: Where can I find other courses in the "Intermediate Python" series?
answer: You can find other courses in this series by visiting https://www.ualberta.ca/en/information-services-and-technology/research-computing/bootcamps.html.

question: What is the name of the workshop designed to help with organizing data?
answer: The workshop is titled "Data Journeys: Tears, Tabs and Terrible File Names—A Survivor's Guide to Organizing Your Data".

question: What are the learning outcomes for the "Data Journeys" workshop?
answer: Participants will be able to identify common pitfalls in data organization, understand best practices for file naming, folder structures, and version control, and develop a personalized system for managing their own data.

question: Is the "Data Journeys: Tears, Tabs and Terrible File Names" workshop an online event?
answer: Yes, it is an online event, and registration is required to receive the event link.

question: Will the "Data Journeys: Tears, Tabs and Terrible File Names" workshop be recorded?
answer: Yes, the workshop will be recorded, and the recording will be available online and sent to all registrants.

question: Who should attend the "Data Journeys: Tears, Tabs and Terrible File Names" workshop?
answer: The workshop is for anyone who has struggled with chaotic data, cryptic file names, or organizing their data.

question: Is the "Data Journeys" workshop part of a series?
answer: Yes, it is the first of a four-part workshop series related to data and research data management.

question: How can I register for the "Data Journeys: Tears, Tabs and Terrible File Names—A Survivor's Guide to Organizing Your Data" workshop?
answer: You can register for the workshop at https://libcal.uwaterloo.ca/event/3939273.

question: Who should I contact for accommodation requests or questions regarding the "Data Journeys" workshop?
answer: You can reach out to libevents@uwaterloo.ca with your needs or questions.
